dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6481 IH: To amend the Mineral Leasing Act to require the Secretary of the Interior to reimburse the fee for an expression of interest if the expression of interest becomes inactive, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Hageman introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Mineral Leasing Act to require the Secretary of the Interior to reimburse the fee for an expression of interest if the expression of interest becomes inactive, and for other purposes.

section.header: Expression of interest term and fee reimbursement
section.text: Section 17(q) of the Mineral Leasing Act (30 U.S.C. 226(q)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in the heading, by striking Fee for;
in paragraph (1), by striking nonrefundable; and
by adding at the end the following:
An expression of interest submitted under this section shall remain active for a term of not less than 5 years.
If an expression of interest becomes inactive, the Secretary shall refund the fee for the expression of interest to the person that submitted the expression of interest.
